labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to facilitate interaction with Slack workspaces by providing tools to manage messages, channels, and user information. Its core functionality revolves around sending, retrieving, and managing Slack messages, as well as interacting with user profiles and workspace events. This server enables automation and integration of Slack-related tasks, making it a communication and collaboration tool.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Communication Tools" was chosen because the server's main purpose is to interact with Slack for messaging and user information, which are core communication activities. "API Integration" is a secondary label because the server functions as an intermediary between MCP and Slack's API. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality adequately.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Slack
server_info_crawled.author: @smithery-ai/slack
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable interaction with Slack workspaces. Supports subscribing to Slack events through Resources.

tools.name: slack_list_channels
tools.description: Deploy Server @smithery-ai/slack Try in Playground slack_list_channels

tools.name: slack_post_message
tools.description: Post a new message to a Slack channel or reply to a thread

tools.name: slack_add_reaction
tools.description: Add a reaction emoji to a message

tools.name: slack_get_channel_history
tools.description: Get recent messages from a channel

tools.name: slack_get_thread_replies
tools.description: Get all replies in a message thread

tools.name: slack_get_users
tools.description: Get a list of all users in the workspace with their basic profile information

tools.name: slack_get_user_profile
tools.description: Get detailed profile information for a specific user

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@smithery-ai/slack/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
